summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Marie Villafaña and defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz regarding plea agreement negotiations for Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss sentencing guideline calculations, with Villafaña stating the U.S. Attorney will not accept less than 18 months of prison time.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Defense attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein in plea agreement negotiations, corresponding with the Assistant U.S. Attorney about sentencing guidelines and call scheduling.

persons.name: A. Marie Villafaña
persons.context: Federal prosecutor corresponding with defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz regarding the draft plea agreement for Jeffrey Epstein, discussing sentencing calculations and stating the U.S. Attorney's position on minimum prison time.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein', the subject of the plea agreement negotiations, with sentencing guidelines being calculated for his case.

connections.description: Lefkowitz is representing Epstein in plea agreement negotiations with federal prosecutors.
Villafaña is the federal prosecutor negotiating the plea agreement for Epstein's case.
Opposing attorneys negotiating the terms of Jeffrey Epstein's plea agreement via email correspondence.

events.title: Plea Agreement Negotiations
events.description: Email correspondence between defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz and Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Marie Villafaña regarding sentencing calculations and terms for Jeffrey Epstein's plea agreement.

locations.context: Office location of Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Marie Villafaña

keyFacts: Prosecutors calculated Epstein's potential sentencing guidelines at 24-30 months with a criminal history category of I, resulting in Zone D.
Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Marie Villafaña stated the U.S. Attorney 'will not go below 18 months of prison/jail time' and would 'strongly oppose' any suggestion to do so.
The emails reference calculations based on treating the case 'as though there were only one victim' for sentencing guideline purposes.
The correspondence shows active negotiation between defense and prosecution regarding Epstein's plea agreement terms in September 2007.
